verses.kjv: The king’s heart is in the hand of the LORD, as the rivers of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.
verses.ct: The LORD directs a king's heart like streams of water — he guides it wherever he chooses.

verses.kjv: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes: but the LORD pondereth the hearts.
verses.ct: People think everything they do is right, but the LORD examines their hearts.

verses.kjv: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
verses.ct: Doing what is fair and just matters more to the LORD than offering sacrifices.

verses.kjv: An high look, and a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked, is sin.
verses.ct: Arrogant eyes, a proud heart, and the ambitions of the wicked — all of these are sin.

verses.kjv: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want.
verses.ct: The plans of a hard-working person lead to abundance, but everyone who rushes ends up in poverty.

verses.kjv: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.
verses.ct: Wealth gained through lies is a fleeting vapor, chased by those who are pursuing death.

verses.kjv: The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.
verses.ct: The violence of the wicked drags them to ruin because they refuse to do what is right.

verses.kjv: The way of man is froward and strange: but as for the pure, his work is right.
verses.ct: A guilty person's path is twisted and strange, but the conduct of the innocent is upright.

verses.kjv: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.
verses.ct: It's better to live in a corner on the roof than to share a spacious house with a quarrelsome wife.

verses.kjv: The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.
verses.ct: The soul of a wicked person craves evil; even their neighbor receives no compassion from them.

verses.kjv: When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
verses.ct: When a mocker gets punished, the inexperienced learn a lesson; and when a wise person receives instruction, they gain knowledge.

verses.kjv: The righteous man wisely considereth the house of the wicked: but God overthroweth the wicked for their wickedness.
verses.ct: The righteous person carefully observes the household of the wicked, and God brings the wicked to ruin because of their evil.

verses.kjv: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.
verses.ct: Whoever ignores the cries of the poor will eventually cry out themselves and get no response.

verses.kjv: A gift in secret pacifieth anger: and a reward in the bosom strong wrath.
verses.ct: A secret gift calms anger, and a hidden bribe soothes intense rage.

verses.kjv: It is joy to the just to do judgment: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
verses.ct: When justice is carried out, it brings joy to the righteous but terror to those who practice evil.

verses.kjv: The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding shall remain in the congregation of the dead.
verses.ct: Anyone who strays from the path of understanding will end up among the dead.

verses.kjv: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
verses.ct: Whoever loves luxury will become poor; whoever loves wine and fine food will never get rich.

verses.kjv: The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.
verses.ct: The wicked become a substitute for the righteous, and the unfaithful take the place of the upright.

verses.kjv: It is better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious and an angry woman.
verses.ct: It's better to live out in the desert than with a wife who is argumentative and angry.

verses.kjv: There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up.
verses.ct: Valuable treasure and fine oil are stored in a wise person's home, but a fool consumes everything they have.

verses.kjv: He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.
verses.ct: Whoever pursues righteousness and mercy will find life, righteousness, and honor.

verses.kjv: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.
verses.ct: A wise person can scale the walls of a city defended by warriors and tear down the stronghold they trusted in.

verses.kjv: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
verses.ct: Whoever guards their mouth and tongue keeps their soul out of trouble.

verses.kjv: Proud and haughty scorner is his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.
verses.ct: "Mocker" is the name for a proud and arrogant person who acts with overflowing contempt.

verses.kjv: The desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour.
verses.ct: The cravings of a lazy person will be the death of them, because their hands refuse to work.

verses.kjv: He coveteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giveth and spareth not.
verses.ct: All day long the lazy person wants more and more, but the righteous give generously without holding back.

verses.kjv: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind?
verses.ct: The sacrifice of a wicked person is already disgusting — how much worse when they offer it with evil intentions?

verses.kjv: A false witness shall perish: but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.
verses.ct: A lying witness will be destroyed, but someone who truly listens will speak with lasting authority.

verses.kjv: A wicked man hardeneth his face: but as for the upright, he directeth his way.
verses.ct: A wicked person puts on a bold front, but an upright person carefully considers their path.

verses.kjv: There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD.
verses.ct: No wisdom, no understanding, and no strategy can succeed against the LORD.

verses.kjv: The horse is prepared against the day of battle: but safety is of the LORD.
verses.ct: A horse may be equipped for the day of battle, but victory comes from the LORD.
